Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Among the seven contributing centers , the proportion of patients for whom the observed phenotype did not match the predicted phenotype was 4 % - 23 % ( P < . 0001 ) , suggesting that differences in methods used for mutation detection or phenotype classification may account for a considerable proportion of genotype - phenotype inconsistencies .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| genotype - phenotype inconsistencies |

Note: "genotype-phenotype inconsistencies" is considered as a disease/disorder in the context of genetic research. It refers to the situation where the expected symptoms or characteristics (phenotype) of a person with a certain genetic makeup (genotype) do not match the actual observed symptoms or characteristics.
